[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38888018-United-Critics/] Please follow [b]United Critics[/b] for quality reviews[/url]

[h2]The Entrepreneur Review[/h2]

[h1]Father‚Äôs Bar[/h1]
During your life, your father was the closest thing to you, as your mother passed away during your birth. But that did not put your dad in a sad mood, no. He was filled with joy at getting you and has been with you ever since.
Until now, two years apart, because you followed your dream and went to study law school, and now you are in need of returning upon your father‚Äôs death.
Take over his bar and fix it up. Keep it in good shape, keep his dream live on, and while you're at it, see what will happen with your lust life.
Good luck.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Just because the story is so long, I thought I‚Äôd first talk a little about the first characters that the player will meet (aka, roomies, and best friends).
 
First, your old best friend, whom you had to leave when you traveled away to law school. Her name is Lucy, and you two have been inseparable since kindergarten. Your dad was like her own father as well, her second father.
She got depressed when you left, and she didn‚Äôt like anything about herself. But once you got back and she noticed you in the bar after seeing the note ‚ÄúFor Hiring‚Äù she got overflown with joy. And soon later got hired by you.
 
Second, your roommates.
Valentine, Alexa, and Laura. These three beautiful women, who all live under the same roof.
Valentine, Facegrammer some sort of social media. She is very famous and very self-aware of her private life after what happened in her past.
Alexa, Collage girl who‚Äôs learning to become an actor. She is very shy but hides it with her acting, but with the help of you, she is growing braver.
Laura, Divorced women who‚Äôs working as a hairdresser. She‚Äôs the one who interviews new potential roommates and manages most things around the house.
 
Then there are, of course, more women, but that comes later in the game. I‚Äôve played the game for 3,8 hours, and these four are the main side characters.
There is Elena, who is a fellow student at Alexa‚Äôs school. We hate her, and she gets turned on by getting rejected. She is the first of them all who is willing to please you.
 
The game begins with the player sitting down in front of one of the characters, Valentine. The devs favorite character, in his opinion,.
And giving us some information about the dev who made this game. Kind of making him sound bigger and better than what he is, but it only makes it a bit funny.
 
The story is that your father has passed away, and his last wish was for you to keep his dream (the bar) alive. And as you get back, you will move into a house with three roommates, all girls, who will make your life a bit more spicy.
While hanging out with each other, a new adventure will happen, and even more people will be introduced.
Working on the bar during the mornings with your new employee and hanging out with the girls during the rest of the day.
 
The rest of the story is about where you need to go and explore yourself. If I were to finish the whole game, well, then I would maybe be 24 hours plus in.
So try this game out, as it‚Äôs a very good price and a very long, interesting story with a lot of content. I bet you won‚Äôt get bored from this, or maybe from all the reading.

[h1]Visual & Audio[/h1]
[b]Visuals[/b]
The graphics and its textures look good, but the dev might over praise his own work. Either way, the animations are smooth and clean, and the visuals have small or even fun details in the background or specific objects.
For example, in some scenes, the player will see people or animals in the background of the main character chatting with someone. And during scene switches/next text, the object(s) or people can have moved, or something is happening to them.
So even if the main character is doing their business, the world around them is doing stuff as well, not simply standing still in one position in all the dialog scenes with the main character and his friends.

[b]Audio[/b]
The Entrepreneur has a large variety of music selections. So for some scenes, there will be one music theme and a song. And when a new scene/chapter begins, either a new song will play or there will be silence for a few scenes.
It's hard to explain, but the music is wonderful.
 
The dev have also thought through and put together the most fitting songs for the fitting moments/scenes.
If the song finishes playing before the scenes are complete, then it will restart the song from the beginning and play it up again.

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
[List][b]Pros[/b]
[*]Mysterious Story
[*]Visuals
[*]Music
[*]Animations
[*]Consequences of decisions
[*]Lots of content ‚Äì Long gameplay
[*]Good Price

[b]Cons[/b]
[*]Spelling
[/List]

[h1]My final little thoughts[/h1]
I have played this game so far for 3,8 hours, and I have only unlocked 2 achievements out of 25, so I can clearly say that this game has a good amount of content, story, and gameplay.
 
And as for how much I‚Äôve played the game so far, I truly enjoy it, and I highly recommend it. And for such a price, with this amount of content and gameplay, I am having a hard time finding cons to it.
One small con that I could add, which isn‚Äôt big at all, is the spelling. The dev will also inform the player at the start of the game that there might be a few spelling errors in the game, and he does apologize for them.

Rating: 9/10
House, House, House, Mansion, House

[b]Tl;dr:[/b] It's a good game but not quite as good as Leap of Faith as some others are saying. 

[b]Pros:[/b]

+ Good looking characters
+ Story was interesting enough
+ I liked the non-sexual animations
+ Overall good renders
+ Good range of humor
+ Fun easter eggs here and there
+ Non-harem made it hard to choose a girl but also kept it interesting
+ It's a complete game; no seasons to wait for

[b]Cons:[/b]

- There are plot holes
- I didn't care for the soundtrack
- The ending isn't very satisfying
- Sexual animations were a little rough
- Minor poke-through in a few renders

[b]Closing thoughts:[/b]

I saw a lot of praise for this game in the reviews, many of them saying it was on par with Leap of Faith but I disagree. It's a good game in its own right but the writing and characters weren't as strong as LoF. I only got one ending but it seems like they're all basically montages of whatever girl you end up with. It didn't particularly feel satisfying. All in all I liked it enough to be willing to check out other games by this developer.

A note I think will matter to people who are looking at this VN:
The sexual scenes are brief and you'll mostly only get a few nude shots until toward the end of the game. (it's ~10 hours long for a single play through)

--
It starts with a message from the dev that this is his first game, which is honestly surprising given the overall quality.

There were a handful of renders or animations which had something like slight model clipping or a couple times I saw a head moving at a weird angle but otherwise they're all very high quality, realistic and polished.

The story is strong too, I was invested, surprised and satisfied from start to finish. The writing could use some polish, a few typos, but it flowed nicely so I didn't get stuck on them.

I feel like I'm nit picking to point out those flaws because otherwise it's a solid 10/10, I'm going to keep an eye for future things from the dev.

This is a top tier romantic v.n. it has flirting and romance and sex and a great plot. If you only care about the sex item in my list then you should get "Fresh Women." But if you like Being a D.I.K. or "Love of Magic" or "City of Broken Dreamers" then this is the v.n. for you. Great plot and nice twists. It is a lot like "Acting Lessons" but not as dark.

It's good, don't need much of a discount for it to be a very worthwhile purchase. There are a couple of negatives, part of the story is a little too ridiculous to be believable, and the expressions female characters make when they are exasperated, well they scrunch their faces up like a pouting child, that seems to break the immersion somewhat. For an adult AVN, the pacing leans a little too far towards the N,  and often goes too long without the A part. 
Having got all of that out of the way, most of the story is solid for an AVN, the adult stuff is good quality, the main characters are developed well, and choices absolutely matter, you can get 3 good playthroughs out of this, and it does have the skip function working unlike some games so when you go back it will go much quicker. 
You know, now that I think about it some more, it is worth getting this at full price, much better value than most of the other options out there

First of all this is one of the most engaging games I have played in a while. It ranks up there with two giants. Leap of Faith and Chasing Sunsets.  The story is very exciting and full of suspense. One of the things that really stood out are the renders of the girls. My god they are beautiful all most life like. I found myself staring at them during game play, taking in there features, the bodies are well proportioned. Also the background was very unique, you could see things happening in the background while the MC engaged in conversation. The sex scenes were tasteful and erotic. All in all a game you must have. Finishes the first play thru which was a lot of time for the price, 10 hours to be exact. Going back for other play thru's. om a scale of 1 to 10 I would give this game a 9.

Quite possibly one of the top-five visual novels I've ever played. There are some things it doesn't do perfectly. In my playthrough, I decided on my path within the first 30 minutes, but the game kept giving me chances to change my mind for several hours. Some people might like that flexibility, though, so I can't hold that against it. I played through the story in just a couple of sessions, and I think that says more about the game than any of the small gripes I had. People who prefer their AVNs to be non-stop sex-em-ups might see it differently, but for me, this game ranks up there with the likes of Artemis and Acting Lessons. If you liked those, I think this is easily worth your time.

Okay just finished play-through  for the first time...(I play too many of these games and have no life....I know I admit it) and had to do a review right away. It's a pretty awesome story, great renders and animations, my compliments to the creators of this top notch avn. If your just looking for fapping material it may be a bit slow for you, but if you appreciate quality and miss titles like "leap of faith" or "acting lessons" this one will  fill the void.

Really good VN.

Not too long, not too short, just the right length I would say.

I really enjoyed the story and the characters. It has some really good music as well.

Another big plus is that its a complete story with ending so no need to wait for years for other seasons to see the end.

Renders are all high quality and really good.

I would say its weakest point are the animations, some are better than others but its nowhere near the high quality animations that some other games have. Not a huge problem though.

All in all its a great VN and I highly recommend it.

The Entrepreneur is an alright AVN. The story was engaging got me hooked, Stunning renders. Multiple routes to go for will take a decent amount of time to get em ( i guess it also depends on how fast you go through them :D ).

The downside? Music choices could be better. Lack of sex scenes but for me it's alright the story makes up for it but I was really expecting more and I wish the endings had more to it (short epilogues perhaps?) rather than a compilation of renders of the girl that you ended up with.

For the price that they offered its definitely worth it. You guys should really give this AVN a shot.

As far as AVNs go, this is a pretty good one. It's basically Leap of Faith Lite (not as sad or deep, but a good story with strong characters). I have two primary criticisms. One is that the scenes are, as mentioned elsewhere, fairly short. The players go from 0 to 60 real fast and don't last long. They are, in contrast to some other AVNs, in service to the story rather than the reason the story exists. The second problem I had, and this was the larger one by far, is the final (of 4) episodes. The pacing is horrendous, it drags out forever, and the whole thing becomes this convoluted twisty thriller thing that just doesn't fit with the rest of the game. It's not *bad*, but it's frustrating to get through the first time. 

One thing I noticed here, and I had this same thing with College Kings, is that it seems like the game drives you toward a certain love interest. Like, you can reject her multiple times and still have a shot. 

Finally, Lucy = best girl.

Good game: likable, realistic characters, interesting plot, good writing (some grammatical errors that will no doubt at some point be addressed).  It is a complete game, so no waiting for future seasons and it leaves you looking forward to the developers future work.
Very french story, very slow-witted protagonist. But likable pretty girls helps a lot.

This was an awesome story, not much Sexual scenes, but the story is strong

Pros:
- Characters are well done
- Scenes are used to support the story
- Choices do matter 
- Story is well written

Cons:
- Story gets a bit boring in some sections but not much
- Scenes needed to be more interactive allow you to choose to cum inside or out
- Some scenes felt more cartoony than being real

Overall: This is an easy recommend, well written and kudos to the dev for the many twists in the story.

The Entrepreneur is an adult visual novel by MisterMaya.
It is choice driven.
It is complete.
Graphics are good.
There isn't any free roam scenes.
There isn't any mini-games.
The story is good.
The achievements all work.
This has the standard six slot save and many pages.
There is a back button as well as mouse wheel control of the text.
The skip option works with both read and unread text.
This game has all the standard controls which makes it enjoyable. 
The story is interesting and gives you different outcomes at the end.

Good story. Great ladies to choose from. Took about 7 hours for one play through. Like the fact that the story is complete so you won't have to wait years for the developer to finish unlike so many other AVN's out there. Maybe not a fan of the fact that what ending you get is not completely clear because there is no this is the moment to choose who you end up with. Instead the ending is determined by a series of choices so if you to unlock all the endings most likely need to use a guide. Overall a very good game. Just know that while the story is very good the adult scenes are very limited. If you play AVN's and skip the dialogue just to get to the adult scenes this game is not for you.

I liked this very much. It's quite short compared to most of visual novels out there but it tells you the story without dragging it on. The renders are very beautiful, songs match the scenes and the characters are likable. 

My only complaint is that I would've liked the endings to be a little more expanded with epilogues instead of slideshows of few pictures though.  Being a short story there aren't much choices overall but in the end it is worth  the price and the experience.
Very good story that kept me intrigued. Not as many sex scenes as many other games like this but they were excellent. 10 hours of game play to get to an ending.
i thought this was an excellent game...it was a complete game: good plot, nice ladies, really good story

Feels worth the price. Was a long game atleast in my mind. The story branches were detailed and well thought out. Overall, I really enjoyed to see how it ended. Animations were pretty decent, sotry made you feel connected like your choices mattered.
Story maybe good but if you're in for the action the scene are scarce, short and too much clicking.

The visuals of this game are fantastic.. the animations are brilliant.   This is a story with adult components and not just a porn game.  If you are going to blaze through this game to the "good parts", you may want to pass.  If you want an engaging story with some adult content, this is a refined option.   Good first game.

A nice solid little game that's fully complete, unlike most visual novels on Steam.

On first impression, this game has a very bland setting. The conflict in the story isn't anything better either, as the moment it begins, you can already see how it will all play out, which isn't disproven by the climax. A lot of the initial dialogue is also structured as if it was written for a school PSA, where everybody has to constantly reassure each other of every minute thing, something that doesn't play out in real conversations. Most of this is fixed in the middle arc, but there is still one too many scenes where characters are reminiscing events that have already been beaten into your head. 

If you can put up with the story babying you often, you can greatly enjoy one of its biggest strengths, which is its vibrant choices. Most of the decisions you have to make are tough, and their results become very rewarding because you properly see the effects they almost always cause. Once you get past the introductions, the game also starts to provide numerous new story angles, all with fun scene rewards and new NPCs. These two things pretty much save and make the game.

The art quality is decent too, and I'm glad to report that the animations are smooth. This game goes even a step beyond what most VN do and provides numerous B-roll cutscenes, but the final adult gallery count is a bit on the short side. You can only pursue 4 characters in the game, but even these four only get a total of maybe two scenes. You're going to be doing more reading than partaking for the final chapter because all the steam will have run out by this point.

This game should have been more bold. When I realized that there wasn't going to be anything more after the second scene for each main NPC, I didn't bother to read how everything concluded. The last chapter unnecessarily spends wrapping elements up that were already well resolved, and none of the cast has anything left to explore. There should have been more variety of tragedy and turmoil in the first few arcs for me to be invested in how the main conflict resolves. Had the game just made it so that the last chapter was me hanging out with the NPCs in my route of choice, providing one innovative scene after another, it would have been much more impactful than what it went with.

ok i admit i have not played too much of this yet, I have only played around 45 mins, however I can usually tell within the first 10 minutes, if these types of game will keep my interest or not, and I must say this game has me gripped, the characters look great especially Lucy, and the story so far seems good, it isn't a boring college frat story, so that is a bonus. the only downside i have with this game is the introduction, i find those types of introductions cringe, and a waste of time, but once you get past that, the game itself is great, I can not wait to play more of this game, but just from the short time I have played it, I can safely say, I can recommend this game.

This is my first time posting a review on here, but I felt this game deserved to be my first one. The Entrepreneur is one of the best visual novels that I've played for a while, and I can really only think of positive things to say about it. 

Firstly, it's a complete game unlike a lot of a AVN that are out at the moment. I'm not quite at the end of the game yet but I don't think I'm far off and I'm at just over 4 hours. I reckon by the time I'm done that my first playthrough will be around 5 hours. But, I know there will be replay value because there'll be other girls paths to take. So the game length and replayability is decent. Not the longest game, but for under ¬£10 I think you'll get your money's worth.

Now, onto the meat of the game - the story is great and that's important for a Visual Novel. Yes, the sex scenes are important - let's not kid ourselves here - but I've asked for refunds on games where the story or characters fall down. But, thankfuly, without giving away spoilers, the story is compelling with it's fair share of drama, emotion and suspense, plus you have great characters that you care for. Plus, the Main Character isn't a massive douchcanoe unlike a lot of AVNs and that is SO important because, again, I've returned games where the Main Character isn't enjoyable to play. So, a strong story and strong characters really make this a  joy to play. Plus, the writing is good and even though the developer apologies for English not being his first language (he's French, IIRC) it doesn't impact the writing or the story. I've played VNs where the English translations are really poor and the script feels quite stilted and unnatural and it does spoil my enjoyment of the game. But, there's no such issue here. It's a great story, with strong characters, and it feels like my choices are making a difference.

There's a good variety of girls in the game and they're all very well presented and the ones that are love interests are all likeable and fun in their different ways. It's a difficult choice to decide which route to take because they're all great characters and all very attractive. At the moment, I'm going with Lucy because she's gorgeous, funny and fiesty. There are also fun and hot side girls who you can hook up with as well, but doing so might impact your chances with some of the main interests. But you're very well covered when it comes to attractive and compelling girls in this game. The animations are not the best i've seen in an Visual Novel but they are very good and well done. I think, looking at the gallery, I would've liked a couple more scenes with each girl. But, with the length and price of the game I'm not going to complain about it. You're getting a full VN with great story and characters for less than a tenner here and that's a rare thing these days.

Honestly, any criticisms I could level at the game are going to be ntipicking and all in all The Entrepeneur is a fantastic Visual Novel that deserves more attention. I'd definitely put it in my Top 10 Visual Novels that I've played. Heck, maybe even Top 5 depending on how the game finishes up. It's refreshing to play through a whole game and have one that is well-written and genuinely makes you want to keep playing and not skip any of it just to get to the sex stuff. Honestly, massive well done to MisterMaya for producing a great game. If you haven't already, pick it up because I don't think you'll be disappointed.

I have read a good number of AVNs, although this is the first time I have actually taken the time to write a review. I'll discuss what I think are the key elements to an enjoable AVN one at a time below.

Story:
Excellent.  I cared about the plot and the characters from the beginning and was drawn in quickly.  The characters also had a depth and complexity to them that added significantly to the story.

Writing:
Very good.  By admission, the author is not a native English speaker, and that does show from time to time.  Those moments are occasional, however, and in no way detracted from my enjoyment of the story or its fluidity.

Artwork:
The still images were beautiful, as were the characters. Some AVNs will exaggerate certain parts of the human form but not so with this AVN.  The women were simply stunningly beautiful in an almost approachable way.

Animations:
If I had to pick one area for improvement, this would be it.  Some of the physics seemed unnatural and some of the animation speeds were too accelerated.

Overall:
It was one of the better AVNs I've read.  As noted, the animation quality wasn't always on par with the best AVNs I've read, but the story, the characters, and the still artwork all were on par with the best AVNs I've experienced, and that's saying a lot.

I enjoyed this one. It took me about 9 hours to play all four episodes. There are four love interests to pursue not including the side girls. I thought the dialogue was decent to good. The images were good. Most of the music was good. I liked all of the primary love interests. There are some consequences to the choices you make. The story is good for the most part. I saw one obvious plot hole but it wasn't enough to ruin the experience. The animations could be better. But I still think this is a worthy effort for a shorter length AVN. It's better than average, but not top tier. Price per hour played was worthwhile. I totaled 11.5 hours to get four of the endings and 22 of 25 achievements. The only negative I have for this was there weren't quite enough choices and many segments were predetermined, most likely to avoid too much branching in the story.

OK, I got this game because two reviews compared it to the Unicorn that is Leap of Faith. Annnnnnd Well it compares. The story is 10/10, and the game is 9/10 overall. The replay ability is going to be high, because there are variables in the choices I did not master (which is rare for me). It is not a Harem game and you end up with one of four LI. They are all great and lovely characters. There are several other characters and they are all cool too. The Big Bad Guy is a worthy evil opponent. I really liked this game and the story. I have to play again soon so I can get the girl I wanted the first time, and then I will go back and get the other great ladies too. Totally worth it, and I am looking forward to the developers next project and that is probably the biggest endorsement I could give. Oh PS I love the little details and there are a lot of nods to other AVR's, even the for-mentioned LOF. If you are on the fence get this game.

"The Entrepreneur" isn't a porn or harem story.  The game is heavy on story and light on erotica, but both are very well done.

MC returns to the town he grew up in after his father's death. He rents a room in a house with three women, who all become a potential love interest.  The fourth main LI is a childhood friend.  During the story, your choices will prioritize one girl over the others, eventually locking you in a certain path.  Though it seems that regardless of these choices, you can still end up with an LI if somehow their "points" are higher than the others.  In my first playthough I ended up with Val, despite rebuking her advances, instead of Lucy.

The erotic scenes are short but well done, they fit in the story and don't detract of what's going on.  In total the game features 16 erotic scenes, divided across 7 girls (4 LI + 3 optional encounters), all scenes can be skipped or avoided entirely.

To get 100% achievements, you'll have to play through the game several times.  I took me about 8 hours to play through the game once, then another 2 to find all remaining achievements.

My first play through Lasted 17 hours...sorry I like to act out each character anyway.  I don't know what the hell Valentine meant at the beginning with the language barrier etc. This was the most well put together and interesting Story I've read since leap of Faith and Leap of faith was the one that made me cry buckets. I cannot wait to see what else you got dev 5/5 Stars

Although not as big and does not include mini-games like those other games mentioned, this game has a great story with drama, wisdom, and multiple paths for different girls. It took about 9 hours on my first play through, and I plan to play again through two other girls' paths. Note, this game is lighter on the sexual content compared to other AVNs, but it still has nudity and sexiness. Very well done devs. I look forward to other games created by you.

In my opinion this story was marginal, but not good enough for a thumbs up from me.  Here are the Pros & Cons as I see it to help you make up your own mind.
Pros:
1.  The story is complete
2.  The graphics are not bad
3.  You can personalise the name of the main character and the cat
4.  Considering the developer is French, the English grammar is not that bad
5.  Overall the main characters are likeable
6.  I think this developer has potential
Cons:
1.  Blah, blah, blah...  A long story does not always equal a good story
2.  There are two few meaningful choices and even fewer choices as the story goes on
If you are looking for good adult visual novels on Steam I recommend:  Acting Lessons, Depraved Awakenings, Leap of Faith, Love Season, and Sisterly Lust.  Anyway, I hope this is helpful.

Johnny changed and ruined my life. 
It all started two days after I bought Guilty Gear -STRIVE- for the first time. While I was on vacation in Texas, I decided to listen to the game's OST for the first time, searching it up on SoundCloud to listen as I was out and about.

I did not get to listen to the game's OST. SoundCloud kept playing Just Lean, Johnny's theme, instead. It kept occurring until eventually every other song was Just Lean. After joking with some friends, I decided to call it quits for the night and stop listening after nearly the 30th Just Lean appeared. When I returned home, it was unfortunate what little I knew of my fate. 

I was very interested in the game and wanted to expand, choosing to buy a DLC character for $6.99. But out of my indecisiveness, I left it all up to a dice roll. I put Johnny on there as a joke, claiming I'd buy him solely for his song so I could torment others with it. He appeared once again. As the die landed on a two, which was the number I assigned to buying Johnny, my fate was sealed. 

It was destined, as just a day after using him I realized just how hard I fell in love. He is a wonderful character and perfectly matches my taste in playstyle. Johnny is such a girl dad. There is no other character left in the game for my interests. Johnny took his Mist Finer and slashed my brain cells until there was only enough to know and focus on him. His gameplay is, in my opinion, very fun with the long pokes and stylish combos. They say he is a zoner, but he's really more of just a balance character. Her new design is extremely cute, even if I still prefer the old ones more. They managed to take her story into a fun and interesting way and I like it a lot, even if I have a lot of conflict on how the recent designs feel more "normal" (Biggest outliars being Sin, Bridget and May).

When talking about her gameplay... It's a disaster.
She is way too straightforward and lacks any kinf of depth, making her the most dull out of the Strive cast.
Her combo routes aren't interesting or have much potential, when other Strive characters get to differ in that. Her combos are always buttons > (bomb if possible) > buttons > rekka.
She isn't fun to play as or to play agaisnt.
I genuinely do hope she's entirely reworked, it makes me very sad on how they managed to make Strive Bridget more similar to Xrd Elphelt than Strive Elphelt is.
As she is, I can't recommend her as a good DLC addition as it feels like a cashgrab that you have fun with one hour and then go "Wait, that's all she does?".
I know this is prominent in Strive, but even for Strive standards, she goes below that.
Sol gets to do so much stuff and has a lot of depth despite being easy to pick-up. Elphelt however doesn't have that level or nearly half the tools he does. She could've been the strongest, she could've been the weakest, but regardless of that, she's not fun.

Rub a dub dub/10 Elphelt mains would recommend üëç

The returning champion and dreaded demon herself has come to Strive, this time having undergone a spiritual journey of enlightenment. Now the singer for a death metal band, Elphelt has transformed from a game-ruining hellspawn into an offensive beast that's equal parts fun to play as and fight. Elphelt, while having a surprisingly good mid-range presence with some massive buttons (her f.S is comparable to that of Ramlethal), is ultimately a rushdown character who gets in with a combination of strong neutral presence and mobility. While she can break through the opponent's block with left/right mixups in the form of her 214H, a jumping crossup that allows her to attack in the air afterwards, her block pressure comes primarily in the form of her unique rekka, Chain Lollipop.

It starts with 214S, an advancing 20 frame mid that's -2 on block. While lacklustre on its own, it can then be followed up with (214)P, a 14 frame high, (214)K, a 14 frame low, another (214)S, or a (214)H, a 13 frame mid that is -5 on block with massive pushback. (214)S can be repeated infinitely with a 6-frame gap, but following up (214)P/K with anything other than (214)S will end the rekka. In addition, (214)H will always end the rekka, so it's only used to either disengage pressure safely or end a combo. All this means that after starting Chain Lollipop, Elphelt can hammer the opponent with high/low mixups until they guess wrong or successfully mash out of pressure (which is easier said than done.) Add on its insanely satisfying potential in combos, especially after a launch, and you have one of my favourite moves in any fighting game. 

She's not without her weaknesses, though. With a x1.09 damage received modifier, a 5 frame jab as her fastest move, and a 13 frame super as her only reversal, once the tables turn against her, Elphelt seriously struggles to escape pressure.

To wrap it all up, if a character who initiates pressure by playing a strong neutral game only to transition into brutral high/low mixups with a fun, unique repeatable rekka, but who is constantly one blocked c.S away from near-certain doom sounds like a fun time to you, Elphelt is a must-buy.

edit: my opinion on her has changed drastically since i made this review. i will attempt to update it below. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NEW REVIEW

tl;dr: she's incredibly fun and very jumpy, causing her to be the most fun i've had in guilty gear. EVER. even when i just free-balled her i knew pretty much what to do, and i had lots of fun not even knowing half of the moves by heart. you can practically make a million combos with her and i couldn't recommend her more to literally anyone, especially if you're even considering getting her. to me, she seems like ONE of the absolute best ggst characters in the roster (so far), and i can't wait to see her against the other characters! i am so glad that she is in this roster. couldn't have asked for more.

you don't even have to move with her with the joycons/keyboard. you just have to use her moves and she will move for you. she's incredibly lightweight and has like a million different combos you can do with her. she is super fun and nowadays i'd even consider her one of the best characters- she's pretty easy to play but if you want to learn her combos you have to do more with her than just free-ball it (which is what i did in my old review... i JUST recently looked at her movelist a few days ago and after an hour or so of pure testing and whatnot, i've gotten WAY better at her). she is a bit of a cheat, but she is incredibly fun. every time i open the game i go on maniac difficulty and go against whatever character, 5 stocking them and perfecting them like it's nothing. i absolutely love this character. i originally got her just because, but now she's practically my main. i've never been this happy to waste 8 dollars in my life. but enough about me. she's easy to learn for the most part, and very bouncy. if you like sin or any other characters like giovanna nd whatnot, then you'll probably like her. even if you play heavier characters, i feel like her speed would be a nice break. like i said in my old review, her theme is awesome. i still loop it and at this point i know the lyrics. elphelt is genuinely the most fun i've had on guilty gear, and i couldn't recommend her more to anyone even considering getting her. if you're struggling with her, take your time. if you just don't like her, that's fine! everyone has different opinions, and i hope you soon enough find the guilty gear strive character for you.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
OLD REVIEW

tl;dr she's very lightweight with easy playability- would really only need a few tweaks to put her up to the other characters, but other than that she is incredibly fun. in order to beat real players you would need to get used to her, but she is very smooth to play with. also fire theme.

i wanna say one thing right off the bat- she's incredibly slow when it comes to walking towards your enemies, however, most of her speed is used up on her moves. you can practically flow into any move you want with the main hit keys (k, l and sometimes even i or u). she has very low health causing her to nearly die immediately by slayer or potemkin if they hit you with their best move (or just a punch lol), but i feel as if that's a given. she's incredibly lightweight and very very jumpy. she has a gun but she isn't necessarily a ranged character. she doesn't have a meter which makes sense in a way but also doesn't, though i feel as if she's a lot more fun without one. i was originally scared of getting her because of people making her out to be annoying- however, i feel as if this was a fine purchase and a very fun one at that. and to the negative review; i played against my highly experienced friend and still beat him just fine. you just have to be careful with her and really think about your moves, but other than that, i'd say she's fairly beginner friendly and would really only need a few tweaks to get her up to the other characters. also, her theme FUCKING ROCKS. this is the one theme i will be looping on spotify cause it's so good...

She has way too many problems at the moment for me to recommend.
Here is a list:
Her gun hurtbox extends way to far that using any other normals for range besides 5H can be dangerous in certain matchups.
Her framedata is way to slow for a character that is supposed to be a rush down that many of her normals and specials get beat out in many situations.
She is way to reliant on her rekka.
Her rekka sometimes drops in certain situations against certain characters.
Any character with a dp can beat her rekka which makes up a huge portion of her game plan.
She is not very flexible or versatile.
I know every character needs a weakness but some of these weakness straight up negate the some her design purpose and leads to matches being less fun and more frustrating, or worse, boring.
I hope next patch arc sys some of the problems stated or else I'm dropping Elphelt.

Honestly I was skeptical when she first released, but outside of the occasional "girl power" line making me a cringe a bit, I absolutely love her.  Although I'll admit that I'm a bit bias as she was my main in Xrd.

[b]Personality[/b]
I was a bit worried that the heavy metal singer personality would completely replace her old personality from Xrd.  I'm glad that it was more of an addition to her pre-established personality, rather than a retcon of said pre-established personality.

[b]Design[/b]
I don't love her official artwork, but I love her in-game appearance, it's cute.  (Also the microphone gun is really cool.)
The biggest complaint I have is that I wish her 2nd color palette was her primary color palette, but I can just use the 2nd color palette instead so it's not really an issue.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Her fighting style is fast-paced and offense focused.  I hate being on the defensive in fighting games, so having tools to turn the tables and force my opponent on the defensive has definitely improved the gameplay experience.

[b]Theme[/b]
This game has probably one of my favorite soundtracks of any game I've played and Elphelt's theme "Extras" does not disappoint.

[b]Summary[/b]
This review is mostly just me fangirling about Elphelt, but her addition to STRIVE has made me love Guilty Gear again, after I had grown resentful towards the game during the 2nd Season Pass.  Can't wait to see who else is added in Season 3.
I'm ashamed that I'm finding this girl as fun as she is but oh my goodness she is so freaking fun. Chain Lollipop is the freest high-low mixup of my life, I love it.

Arc system never fails to impress me with their ability to make old characters refreshing and fun, ABA is an amazing rushdown-esque character that is fun in both modes, her main mechanic jealous rage encourages a more careful playstyle when out of it due to her weak state this encourages fun interactions with other characters as you attempt to punish a move or attempt to initiate a risky offensive, this is possible due to her 2 "defensive" abilities allowing her to gain the upper hand where other characters could not. once in jealous rage the match then becomes a rush to see how much damage you can get off while still maintaining a decent defence (YOU ARE NOT INVINCIBLE IN JEALOUS RAGE, YOU STILL NEED DEFENCE). Her theme is 10/10 and I love what arc has been doing with these returning characters <3

Slayer is everything i had hoped for and more. lore, gameplay, and an interwoven story in the entire guilty gear universe - it's a pleasure to see Slayer make his triumphant return to Strive. 

within his previous iteration in XRd, i was drawn to Slayer because of his closer focus on loops instead of combos; as someone who struggles with long winded strings of hits, his more laissez-faire manner of play really hooked me. i'm more than happy to say that they kept his most integral qualities when porting him over to strive! though i have not had much time to play him just yet, he is absolutely wonderful and i look forward to playing more. now while gameplay is important, of course, i want to touch on something else pertaining to his character - his dandyism, naturally. 

paraphrasing from a thread i made a while back, and as a dandy myself, i can confidently say that Slayer is such a testament to the practice of dandyism as a whole! his gameplay is oozing with dramatic flair and charm, his wit in his story mode is cutting edge, and his lifestyle lets us know precisely what it is that he is about -- dandyism. 

at its core, dandyism is a lifestyle & a socialpolitical statement. it aims to make oneself a spectacle detached from things like race, class, sex, etc, specifically with the intent of fighting back against the upper echelon of things. a dandy always places particular importance on being well-groomed, put together, and full of cunning wit. this persona is a masquerade which often belies a more middle to lower class upbringing, which the dandy strives to escape from or outright abolish. now while in his lore Slayer comes from a noble family, in being what he is, he is still a perfect depiction of dandyism in popular media. 

Albert Camus phrases it best - "The dandy creates his own unity by aesthetic means. But it is an aesthetic of negation. To live and die before a mirror: that, according to Baudelaire, was the dandy's slogan. It is indeed a coherent slogan. The dandy is, by occupation, always in opposition [to society]. He can only exist by defiance . . . The dandy, therefore, is always compelled to astonish. Singularity is his vocation, excess his way to perfection. Perpetually incomplete, always on the fringe of things, he compels others to create him, while denying their values. He plays at life because he is unable to live [life]." Slayer's aestheticism and the ways within which he brings it to the guild uphold the tenets of the act. 

The dandy is not a thoughtless fop, however; he is meticulously defined, yet without definition all the same. he is a statement on nothing and everything at once. and in finding dress, the dandy finds himself and the selfsame passion for all things around him. Slayer's adoration for Sharon and the passion he now finds for the world around him is a renewal of his dandyism after so long spent practising it!

Slayer is a character who historically has microscopic range, a somewhat difficult time putting together combos, relies on jank to be viable, and occasionally he gets lucky, at which point the opponent disintegrates. He's traditionally a low tier pick, but people play him because he's cool, or they really love the jank.

In this game, Slayer has microscopic range, a moderately difficult time putting together combos, relies on jank to be viable, and about 40% of the time he gets lucky, at which point the opponent disintegrates, usually to a dandy shirtless ultra mega punch. For whatever reason, this makes people very upset.

To placate the Xrders, Slayer's gimmick is danger time, but without the RNG. Hitting the opponent with blood sucking cosmo- UNIVERSE bestows danger time-like properties to Slayer's next hit, prompting a huge UNIVERSE!!!!!!! on the screen instead of COUNTER!!!!! enabling kuso levels of damage and combo routing that even HnK veterans can agree are simply hilarious.

[h2]Chaotic Pursuit[/h2]

[h1]Kinda Reminds Me Of Brotato NGL‚Ä¶[/h1]

Chaotic Pursuit is a hardcore top-down shooter that combines cute graphics with intense gameplay. In this review, we'll delve into the game's storyline, gameplay mechanics, visuals and audio, as well as its pros and cons. So, grab your trusty weapon and get ready for an adrenaline-pumping adventure where a single missed shot could be your downfall.

[h1]About This Game [/h1]

[h2]Storyline [/h2]

In Chaotic Pursuit, you step into the shoes of a blind marksman armed with superhuman senses. Your mission is to eliminate one-eyed creatures relentlessly pursuing you. While the premise is straightforward, it adds an intriguing layer to the game's intensity. The narrative may be minimal, but it effectively serves its purpose as a backdrop to the chaos that ensues.

[h2]Gameplay Mechanics [/h2]

The core gameplay of Chaotic Pursuit revolves around shooting and dashing skills. The twist here is that you have no room for error ‚Äì miss a shot, and you're out! This unique mechanic adds a thrilling level of tension to each encounter. The game offers 20 challenging levels set in various environments such as forests, deserts, ice lands, and farms. You'll need to rely on your sharp aim and quick reflexes to survive.

The simplicity of the controls is a double-edged sword. On one hand, it makes the game accessible and easy to pick up. On the other, it might leave players craving more depth and variety in their abilities. The promise of hidden secrets adds an element of mystery and encourages players to explore further. Lastly, do not assume that the game is very easy when you just start playing it. Trust me, it gradually becomes harder and the overconfidence you rack up will work against you.

[h2]Visuals & Audio[/h2]

Chaotic Pursuit's visuals strike a charming balance between cute and chaotic. The one-eyed creatures are adorably menacing, and the game's environments are well-designed, offering a refreshing change of scenery across its different maps. However, some players might wish for more diversity in character design and enemy types.

The audio in Chaotic Pursuit complements the gameplay nicely. The sound effects enhance the tension, making every shot and dash feel impactful. While the soundtrack is catchy and fits the game's atmosphere, it can become repetitive over time.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] The unique "one-shot, one-kill" concept adds a thrilling layer of tension and challenge.
[*] With 20 levels spanning diverse environments, there's a decent amount of content to keep players engaged.
[*] The game's cute yet menacing art style sets it apart from typical shooters.
[*] Chaotic Pursuit is budget-friendly, making it accessible to a wide range of players.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Some players may find themselves wishing for more levels, enemy types, and abilities to keep the gameplay fresh.
[*]  The game's simplistic controls might leave more hardcore gamers looking for additional complexity.
[*] The catchy soundtrack can become repetitive during extended gameplay sessions.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Chaotic Pursuit is an engaging top-down shooter that stands out thanks to its unique "miss a shot and you're out" gameplay mechanic. It offers a good challenge with its 20 levels and cute visuals. However, its simplicity and limited content may leave some players wanting more. Despite its shortcomings, Chaotic Pursuit is an enjoyable experience, especially given its affordable price point. If you're ready for a slightly punishing top-down shooter with a twist, give it a shot, but be prepared to embrace the chaos!

This game is so polished! I haven't played much of it yet, but I have a few pieces of feedback nevertheless.

The game feels a little too "smooth". Don't get me wrong, I love the amount of polish here, but the movement of the platform feels to clunky and delayed, and on top of that, they reduce speed with the slowdown mechanic which makes it incredibly hard to move them precisely and quickly with the slowmo enabled. The game feels really clunky at times - and for a precision puzzle game that's a big nope.

Other than that, it's really good. I could 100% see this getting picked up by a larger distributor or developer, and with some more development time, turn into a 10/10 puzzle title.

At the moment, feels more like a protoype type thing. Not in a bad way, but in the sense that it needs a little more cooking time to get all of the gameplay issues I mentioned out.

Short little action game that offers nice art, fluid gameplay and cool atmosphere.

The game's protagonist is an anonymous individual who wakes up next to a heap of corpses. A beating orb just next to it entices him to investigate. He receives a blade and understands exactly what must be done.

Playing is simple and controls flow well. You only have the sword strike, jump, and dash, which also serves as a dodge. Later on, you obtain a gun and a massive sword attack, both of which come at a cost. Because you lose health with each activation, it's best to save them for challenging situations. There‚Äôs no stamina, so that‚Äôs one thing you don‚Äôt have to worry about. 

The game's world is linear. There is no opportunity to explore or make decisions. You're just traveling in a straight line and taking out enemies, listening to the occasional nice creature you meet along the road, and attempting to figure out what's going on in this odd setting. Basic dashing on platforms and over deadly pits is also included, but this is only difficult towards the end when you juggle different mechanics. 

The only vital information on the screen is a red bar in the upper left corner representing your health. Although every received blow saps quite a bit of your lifeforce, it is relatively easy to regain it. All you have to do is kill an enemy. 

But since you gain very little, it might be smarter to avoid enemies or attack only when it‚Äôs safe to do so. There‚Äôs a nice variety of enemies in each of the locations you visit. Since enemies don‚Äôt drop anything, you might as well ignore them. However, this is not always possible because barriers halt your progress until their guardians are destroyed.

You travel through many environments. True, the game doesn't use many colors, but the world is nonetheless vibrant thanks to excellent pixel art. Each place is distinct and has completely fresh assets and mechanics. A boss blocks you from moving to a new location. They only have a few simple attacks that are easy to learn, so you should have no issue beating them after a few tries. 

Death comes quickly. You won't lose progress because the game saves automatically whenever you enter a new screen. The bad news is that the game saves the amount of health as well. You do not heal after respawning. This means it's very easy to find yourself in a difficult battle with nearly no health. You can grind health from a creatures that generates enemies or destroy a healing object, but these only show up in certain screens.

It doesn't take long to finish the game, perhaps two hours. There are no achievements or rewards at the end, so you will play it once and never again.

Fun, challenging action platformer with a pleasantly moody atmosphere. Platforming is inventive and while it doesn't break the mold, it executes on its mechanics well. Combat is a bit lackluster, feels more like a puzzle to solve rather than a reaction based challenge. Very short, hit credits in my 1.5 hours, but worth it for the price.

Thank god that Penusmic is a pixel art wizard, cause everything else in this game is shocking. It has the foundations of a pretty solid experience, but the developer clearly had no intentions of polishing this one out. There are thousands of typos, a bunch of untested level design, broken controller support, tons of baffling design choices, and I-frames don't work half the time. Also the volume bar resets when you enter a new room which I found to be the most exciting part of the game. 

The game released way before the developer estimated, and I think that the game would've at least been playable if it wasn't so rushed. The final boss was decent to say the least. For ¬£9, this is a bit of a scam, however I hope the developer got a lot of experience when making this game, and I wish him all the best in the future.

My only real complaint is that the English is awkward in places.

This felt like a very well made little game. The emotional story and the puzzle mechanics revolving around a past-self worked really well together throughout, and I enjoyed the mechanics changing along with the tone of the character each chapter. Most rooms needed some thought to get through and it was fun to solve the easier and more difficult ones alike, and the B-Side levels that show off each chapter's mechanics at their most complex was a great addition too. I'm glad I found and played this, and it's a very easy recommend.

I really highly recommend this as it's both a good puzzle game and the story feels very connected to it. I really love how connected the gameplay and the story are. The music is great too, gonna try the B-sides next

Two days after completing the game in around four hours, its charm still resonates within me. The brilliance of this experience lies in the seamless blend of level design and storytelling, crafting a world that is both immersive and profound. I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone with a sense of empathy or those who can find reflections of their own imperfect selves within its characters.

Very sweet and well designed puzzle platformer where you work alongside (or sometimes against) your past actions to solve each level. New mechanics are introduced and combined throughout the game and the difficulty is managed well throughout the whole game, which made every puzzle fun and satisfying to solve. The main story took me just under 3 hours to beat, however there is also and additional set of about 50 "B-side" levels which I haven't tried out yet which contain more difficult puzzles.

One thing this game does a particularly good job of is linking its story to the gameplay - the textboxes appear dynamically throughout each level as you solve them, and the meanings of them relate to both the story as a whole as well as the current puzzle you're solving. This makes solving each puzzle feel even more rewarding, as the character you play as overcomes her struggles alongside you overcoming each level. The only complaint I have is that the english translations can occansionally be a little wonky, although never so much so that the original intent of words is lost.

This is a very good puzzle platformer game! The puzzles are challenging and fair, you can restart a challenge any time if you get stuck and the game teaches you its mechanics really well as you play along. You can't pet the animals though so I substract some points because of this, but overall, I had a good time with the game.

A wonderful exploration of one woman's pysche as she is overcome by grief, but eventually climbs out of the pit of despair.

Full review: https://youtu.be/GrDmOC_oIUs

iz good!

- Beautiful artstyle & music (very calm & chill, plus a sprinkle of sadness)
- Made me think about my own past / choices (and that's hella seldom with video games those days)
- Challenging puzzles
- fair price imo

Played through the Prologue and the first two chapters as of writing this. Planning to play it all the way through tho.
Very well done game, perfectly executed. 5/5.

"Laruaville 2" is a great match-3 game with unique mechanics and minigames (Mahjong, solitaire and hidden object games). It runs flawlessly and it will stimulate your brain! A very tricky match-3 with power-ups and unique ways to solve the puzzles. Help the cute ghosts to fix the moon that has fallen from the sky!

The levels themselves are hard but leave an impression and above all they are fun. So you will be glad it wasn't a piece of cake that required no thinking and ended in 10 minutes. The visual effects, animations and music will help a lot in keeping you calm and focused on the task at hand.
If you are stuck, you can use the hint system, which I find very good, comprehensive and helpful. 

It will keep you busy for hours but without overstaying its welcome and you can always replay it due to its nature. Featuring different modes, minigames and building your town!

One of the most fun and intriguing match-3 puzzle games out there.

For more reviews, follow my curator https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44864435-Mewesome-Reviews/

"Laruaville 3" is a great match-3 game with unique mechanics and minigames (Mahjong and hidden object games). It runs flawlessly and it will stimulate your brain! A very tricky match-3 with power-ups and unique ways to solve the puzzles. Help the cute ghosts restore the seasons and the physical phenomena that accompany them!

The levels themselves are hard but leave an impression and above all they are fun. So you will be glad it wasn't a piece of cake that required no thinking and ended in 10 minutes. The visual effects, animations and music will help a lot in keeping you calm and focused on the task at hand.
If you are stuck, you can use the hint system, which I find very good, comprehensive and helpful. On top of that, they have added a beautifully crafted grimoire as help.

It will keep you busy for hours but without overstaying its welcome and you can always replay it due to its nature. Featuring different modes, minigames and building your town!

One of the most fun and intriguing match-3 puzzle games out there.

My chat loves this game.  It's great for running during advertisements.  Since subscribers and other people who do not see ads have nothing to do during the breaks, this provides them with a fun game to do.
very good game to interact with others, a way to build up game knowledge. Definitely recommend if you are a streamer.

I've been using this game for my stream the last few weeks and my chat absolutely loves it!!
I have the game running when I need to take a break but chatters also like redeeming it with their channel points.
Nice and easy to set up and works seamlessly every stream.

I would recommend this to every streamer out there!!

Chat Guess Games is such a fun stream game. Provides amazing opportunity for chat engagement, getting the blood boiling trying to get the points for guessing the game right. If you are a streamer, this is your perfect idle chat game, BRB game, or even just something to run at any point. Pick it up if you get the chance
Great for chat interactivity on stream. Highly recommend. Also the developer is continuously active and working on it.
Lots of fun. Great as a distraction while chatting, having a slow day or to just scream at other chatters "HOW DID YOU GUESS". Would caps again in chat.
Great addition to any Twitch stream. A lot of fun from the streamer side and the player side. The dev is actively developing and makes frequent updates!

My Chat loves playing this game more than they enjoy my content. The in stream competition to climb the leader board is insane sometimes. I didnt have Chat Guess for my Ad break/Bio break for one stream and i swear my chat was going to riot. 

Unfortunately because i am overshadowed by this game in the eyes of my Chat, I cant give this game a good recommendation.



But seriously I give this game 10 out of 10 Boba Teas. Get this game, you wont regret it! Watching this game from creation to being on steam has been fun. As things are constantly being updated, dont worry if there is a problem. The goofball of a developer will get to it...eventually... hopefully. 

Gero~

I found CGG a fun and creative tool for any streamer looking for a way to engage their Twitch chat, especially during a pre-roll or while taking a break. The developer is active in curating the game database, making bug fixes and providing updates. The retro category addition is a welcome feature that focuses on a different gamer demographic than regular CGG, and I highly encourage retro and family-friendly streamers to get this!

Highly recommend this game. I first got it for breaks in streaming, but the intensity from chat in the competition and leaderboard has me playing it more often now. Get ready to be lauded for your game knowledge - or shamed from your lack XD

Easy to understand interface with idiot proof instructins. And any suggestions or questions are very quickly handled by the dev. 


Ya know what - I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. If you regret getting this game I'll shave all my hair off!

Chat Guess Game has greatly enhanced my Twitch broadcasts by being a simple to use but fantastic way to engage with my community.  It allows Twitch streamers to run a trivia game where chatters attempt to guess the titles/series of a video game with gameplay screenshots and hints that appear on the screen.  There is a leaderboard that keeps score for the individual users in the broadcaster's channel as well as the channel compared to other channels.  it has a pretty substantial library of games it pulls from ranging from the past several decades of gaming.

It's easy to setup by linking to the broadcaster Twitch channel and add as a source to broadcasting software.  I generally run it manually by launching through Steam and toggling autoplay on or off.  Rounds of Chat Guess can also be initialized by your community members with channel points redeems.

CGG been a great addition particularly during BRB screens or times when I have to troubleshoot stream/tech issues in the middle of broadcast.  Gives chat something fun to do while I try to figure out how to unmute my mic or take a lengthy toilet break due to the amount of hot sauce my community redeemed me to drink from a shot glass.  God.

I love this game!

Super handy for when you need to leave stream for a bit!
Also for when you're doing co-working streams, great for viewers who are just chilling and not working!
Also a great way to start/end stream...and warm-up and a wind-down for sure!

But if you're like me and you're just really chatty this is where it shines. I often just sit there with the game on auto-play and chat away, as I find different games appearing on screen seem to bring up new topics CONSTANTLY, it's never ending. Running out of steam on one topic *boom* up pops Black & White "oh hey isn't this designed by Peter Molyneux, that dude who over promises on his game...blah blah blah" and we're back to chatting!

Also the Developer seems to be doing a lot of quality of life updates, as I often come back to see new features added (that I wanted)...and it seems that the selection of games seems to be more curated as time goes on!

I have the game to use in my own stream for engagement, and have played it several times in other streams. CGG definitely poses a challenge for even regular gamers. The Dev is very active in making improvements, and even participates in streams playing the game. The interface is very minimal, but still decently configurable to suit your preferences and your overlay placements.

This is a must have for Twitch streamers. A wide catalogue of games to guess, challenging enough to make even the more serious gamers get involved...and still not get it right! Easy to set up (even I could set it up) and adds a bit of fun competition to your streams. Lynch is regularly working on patches and updates for the game. Very much recommended. Thanks Lynch!
Makes a fun little game around streams - great for adding something interesting to quieter moments, like BRB screens and grinding in game. Would recommend if you're a streamer.

Have it set up to automatically play during breaks in the stream, works perfectly, chat loves playing it, gives them something to do while I go to the bathroom ext.

I highly recommend this game for stream.
Is there really no discord for this game? Game is good leaderboards make it better, there is not many repeats !!

every day i destroy my chat by guessing games better than them

pls add more games i am addicted
alot of fun while streaming! highly recommend if you are streamer!!
Great idle game to play while you are streaming!
Nice and easy to install and run, great fun!

So the year was 1986. According to my mom, she shot me out like an autocannon. A nurse caught me and they all celebrated as she slammed me into the ground shouting touchdown. The nurses picked me up and wrapped me in silk woven blankets. They handed me to my mother. I was just born but apparently, I already knew my first words. 

Chatguess ..... Gaaaaames. 

No one knew what I meant. I drove my parents insane by only ever saying chatguess games. 15 years later I finally learned new words. 

Then one day, I accidentally walked into this bald guys stream. He was making a game. Chatguess Games. My lifes purpose was right there in front of me. Download this game so that while I am on break from my woeful streams, people in my chat can do something. It was so quick to download, I didn't even have enough time to look up some good porn while I waited. 

I downloaded it and instantly, this guy called Jimmy starts showing up and guessing games. He might come with the game, I don't know, but god damn, he is the champion of guessing games. He is what it would be like if the pantheon of gods also included one who knew video games really well. 

But yeah it's a pretty solid game. 10/10. GG's. Pogchamp. Hype. *insert more buzzwords*

Not bad I've just started, but it's kept my interest. I'll update this review when I get more. I would love a glossary for terms at least though. Also I believe the renpy engine is used, never thought about that for a text game, so that's pretty unique if it is the renpy game engine. Give it a try, it's not expensive and you don't really have anything to lose.

Played a bit more, just got Athos and the town. The Humor is so worth it.

This must be one of the most under-rated games/VNs on Steam!  I almost missed it, and its well worth having a look at for the artwork and the music, as well as the entertaining story. I think it was originally made for a cell phone app, but the port to Windows is more professional than many more expensive games from well established developers. 
I have just finished my first run through, and thoroughly enjoyed it! Unlike many VNs, this is not anime, and is based on legends of dragons, elves and other mythical people, and set in a fantasy country sometime in the past. The characters are all individuals, and you can choose the gender of some and whether to romance them or not. You can definitely trade insults with them (some are wonderfully snarky), and have sensitive private moments as well. I had a good ending, but I'm sure I only have part of the story, with a long way to go!
This was crafted by a talented Indie artist, and for less than the price of a coffee or soft drink, you can enjoy a game that will last much longer than the memory of your last drink!

This game is unbelievably amazing I can hardly believe it was created by one person. This feels like it should have been created by a team of at least 3 people.  This feels like a Bioware game without the gameplay, which let's be honest, if you're me the gameplay was just a fun addition to your roleplay romance game. The choices in this game are weighted like a Bioware game and the romanceable characters are fully fleshed out and I want to romance every single one of them. Even the characters who you think you might dislike, if you get to know them a bit you fall in love with them. From what I understand this is one game that takes place in a massive universe and I hope the creator uploads those to steam too! 

Seriously, the choices in this game keep me in such suspense that I have stopped playing just to think out the consequences of one massive choice. Give this game a try, it's incredible, and at two bucks, what do you have to lose?

This game was quite the pleasant surprise. I love text-based interactive fiction games. But I had hesitantly bought this at the time, due to it's very low price. I thought that because the price was so cheap (1.99), perhaps the game was probably super short, or had very little content, but I was completely wrong! It had enough content to be almost 10hrs worth of game-play for me. But that's with me only romancing the 3 male ROs, and playing the best friend route with Gruzi where you romance no one. 

For me though, I'm personally finished with this game now. It was a really great story and I would honestly love to see another within this universe and with more detailed romance scenes and even more descriptive sex scenes, since they were more fade to black. That and the romance scenarios felt very light. 

But either way, I highly recommend this game! I played this on my steamdeck and it worked great, for anyone interested. With how much went into this game, it should honestly be worth more! I'm so surprised it isn't $10.00 instead. You have the options to pick your gender, there's LGBTQ+ romances, there's even some CGs, and background music! Definitely recommend, I don't think you'll be disappointed!
Interesting story, not a fan of the endings, they left me a bit disappointed...however, for the price its well worth the read.

This is a very charming and engaging story! It reminded me a lot of the choose-your-own-adventure books I would read as a kid. Vogvhathos is immersive in a similar way: compelling and fun in a very easygoing kind of way. Also, you can play as a lady who gets a dragon girlfriend. 10/10

Awesome story! 
Super dynamic characters and a cool fantasy world to explore! 
Definitely worth a read, and there's tons of replay value. 
During my first read I'm already planning my next playthrough!
Loved the game. Intricate story with good lore and interesting characters
A nice interactive story.

Really fun little 80's themed, apocalyptic, bullet hell wave shooter, with plenty of enemy variety, upgrade options and replay value!

My favourite build so far is with the sniper, Gloria. I got her trigger and reload speed upgrades up nice and high, then re-rolled a few joker cards for some extra damage upgrades. This carried me all the way up to wave 67!

Loving the contra theme and the 80's style pixel art.

Overall would recommend to fan's of Seraph's Last Stand and Vampire Survivors. Looking forward to what my next build will be!

lol this game is  Awesome  (not sarcasm)   because  the guy was genius and combined the fun of twin-stick side-scrolling shooters  (think " Shoot Many Robots "  (the Xbox 360 version),  

 Rogue Stormers etc, and mixed with that survivor formula for powerups not only DURING your mission but also PERMANENT power-ups you can buy out of your missions,

 Fantastic game this was the first 'unique' game I saw in eons on steam and it's funny I didn't think of it first (I think up 'wave' shooters all the time)  but you have to hand it to this dev he simplified it to the most essential degree and kept exactly what you need for a FUN game and not all that over-worked agenda-pushing crp on steam nowadays,

 Seriously THIS type of game here is exactly what redeems the trash-heap that steam is,

 for literally every 2-5000 games released every year you get a game like this that shows you some dev somewhere is actually thinking up cool  new unique actually 'fun' games and isn't backed by millions to push agendas and nonsense down your throat, 

 so the presentation is going to be 'rough' but the core gameplay and fun-factor are all there - 

 Kudos to the dev, amazing job !

 
(by the way my play time is low because I had to stop playing or else I would play a game like this all day every day until I max out my character and 'beat' it,

 I just don't have the time now so for a game as addicting as this it's better just to uninstall and not think about or else you're always wanting to play it, 

 lol, seriously)

 
 (Also the music is amazing !!!   This type of game is exactly the type that pictures, screenshots and lame overly-picky nerdy reviews  don't do justice to,

 it's a freaking fantastic game if you want to challenge yourself, have fun, not be soaked full of agendas while playing, 

 listening to blasting retro-wave beats etc etc

 There's no justice that games like this get overlooked while all the hype trash gets pushed on steam.

 Don't expect this game to be a 'circus' on start-up, do expect this game to 'pull you in' like retro games used to do, 

 based on their skill-factor, fun factor and challenge factor, (and 'immersion' factor), and you'll 'get it' and have a blast playing this.

 Could it have better presentation?  Of course, when I first played it the first thing I thought of was all the ways I would do 3D models of the graphics etc,

 but point is the dev did what he could do and it's a great thing, far better that he was actually able to 'make' it then try to fancy up the graphics etc and never have released it in the first place)

 Seriously gamers use your brain and support games like this if you want to play anything else besides hyped steam trash..

Very good & different survivors style game. 
Might need a tiny bit more variety, but is quite enjoyable as is and it still is in Early Access, so can't complain.

I can see this game being very rad after some more updates, There seems to be only one audio track and one stage currently. Both are good. Power ups and unlockables feel good so far. When at least one more stage and maybe some more audio track for some variety I would say this is  an easy buy but until then maybe hold out until a little more is added to the game. Giving it a positive since I think I don't think it needs that much more to be a really good game.

the TLDR:
+ Sega Genesis looking art style
+ The music (Even though only one track)
+ Unlockable weapons, upgrades, and characters feel good.

- Needs more stages
- Needs more then one audio track
- Steam cloud saves would be nice
- Since the game is made using the construct game engine not 100% if this will work on the steam deck (When I get some time will try and edit this later if not true)

Roguelite survival game in an arena platform. A bit monotone and tough to play. 

The nature of most survival games like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2321470/Deep_Rock_Galactic_Survivor/]DRG: Survivor[/url] or [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1794680/Vampire_Survivors/]Vampire Survivors[/url] is that it's relatively easy to play. Those games are isometric with a top down view. Survivors Last Stand does it with a sideview, and I don't know if it's done before but it makes the game much harder! You have to be pretty good at platform games, and that is a very specific type of gamer. 

In order to be more pleasing the arena needs more... Maybe a way up so you can walk a circle, or a bit of sidescrolling, I'm not sure.. Plus it looks way too basic now. 

I do think this can work for a certain audience, it just has to be more inviting to play.

I have been following this game for a long time and was so happy to finally get to play the finished version!!  A whole lot of effort clearly went into this -it takes a basic target/archery style game concept and runs with it in the best way -it's overflowing with creativity, every level actually feels unique and interesting often introducing a new mechanic or puzzly gimmick.  It's a really charming game too, I absolutely love the characters and the art and the music -the whole vibe of it!  It has a fun story with it's own twist on robin hood -lots of character and the humor made me legit laugh out loud a few times -and I gotta say it was nice that the level dialogue kind of just goes on in the background in real time so that I didn't have to skip through it when restarting.

The soundtrack and sound design is fantastic -I've had the pirate shanty sounding song stuck in my head all night.  There was a lot of fun secrets and it had some rewards that I haven't really seen done in many other games -like usually you unlock things like character stills or production art, but instead in this game you unlock small cozy campfire conversations that are like little side stories and also you unlock these little scenes that are kind of almost like screensavers that are really neat to check out -some felt like easter eggs to the main story.  

The game didn't overstay it's welcome and left me wanting more -even after getting all the achievements and a couple of them were pretty tough!

Loved it! The characters, animations and puzzles are fun and the backgrounds are lovely. I love that you can just come in and shoot and still succeed, but if you slow down, the mechanics are really solid for making skill shots. Great game!
Really enjoyed this, fun and challenging, love the art and you can tell it was made with a lot of passion

Fun run and gun that won‚Äôt take a lot of your time.

Despite the appearance of a metroidvania, this is an action game where you go through stages in a linear order. The game takes you through three different worlds, each with its own set of enemies. A world is made out of four stages and a boss fight. All can be finished in a couple of hours.

You start with a basic weapon and gain two more as you kill bosses. Because ammo is infinite, you can keep hitting the fire button as much as you like. Rockets, on the other hand, are in short supply. Although a single rocket can take out an enemy easily, it's recommended to conserve them for walls that can't be destroyed with any other weapon and cracked walls that hide collectibles.

Stages are not very long. They involve a combination of platforming, avoiding threats and killing enemies. The difficulty level is pretty easy, so you should have no trouble if you're familiar with the genre. Boss fights can be a bit tricky. The issue is that you are not offered a lot of freedom due to the extremely small areas that make it impossible to avoid enemy shots. Because your character is so large and cannot dodge, your only option is to jump over projectiles and take occasional hit.

The game is short, so achievements motivate you to play it multiple times. Unfortunately, they‚Äôre not fun because around half of them are for not being hit, falling into acid, and even sparing one type of enemy throughout the entire game. One touch or accidental kill can ruin your entire game.
